pullRequest.title: Upgrading to new Key Vault (and MSAL) libraries
pullRequest.bodyText: This PR migrates from the previous-generation Azure Key Vault library and ADAL libraries to the more modern Azure Key Vault and MSAL equivalents.

nodes.bodyText: Could you confirm that these are production release versions?
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText:
@lilgreenbird
This is not how we handle exception messages. Error messages need to be localized and also make sure to throw SQLServerException. Please make sure to change this in all occurrences.
. at the end.

They appear to be:
https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk-for-java/keyvault.html
https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk-for-java/identity.html
But why not start with the latest versions?

      *        Identifier of the client requesting the token.

-     *         when an error occurs
+     *         If either {@code clientId} or {@code clientKey} are {@code null}.

-        credentials = new KeyVaultCredential(clientId, clientKey);
-        keyVaultClient = new KeyVaultClient(credentials);
-    }
-

-     * Constructs a SQLServerColumnEncryptionAzureKeyVaultProvider with a callback function to authenticate to AAD and
-     * an executor service.. This is used by KeyVaultClient at runtime to authenticate to Azure Key Vault.

-     * This constructor is present to maintain backwards compatibility with 6.0 version of the driver. Deprecated for

-    @Deprecated
-    public SQLServerColumnEncryptionAzureKeyVaultProvider(

@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+package com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc;

nodes.bodyText: This is not how exception are handled in the driver, @lilgreenbird please make sure to follow the guidelines.
Please pay attention  to public APIs. We don't want to create public APIs unless it is by design.
Driver should not throw a NullPointerException . Better add a null check to the constructor and throw SQLServerException .
Need to add license header here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+package com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc;

nodes.bodyText: CamelCase here
The methods in this class should probably not be public.
The methods in this class should probably not be public.

These variables shouldn't be public.
Please revert the changes to this file.

nodes.bodyText:
Do we need to deprecate this public interface? If so, why?
I do recall the previous discussion about removing it because we thought we couldn't support it via MSAL. But since we can support it, is there a compelling reason to push applications to the new interface?

nodes.bodyText: This test should not be removed, it is the only test thats actually using SQLServerColumnEncryptionAzureKeyVaultProvider(authenticationCallback).
In pom file azure-security-keyvault-keys version is 4.2.1, its 4.2.0 here.

nodes.bodyText: What is the actual exception type here? is it being thrown as SQLServerException?
Please do not remove this test, it is still valid.
There is no tests for this constructor, please add a few tests. I could only find one test, which only tests bad AKV name.

This is very interesting syntax but can we either link a source for a spec detailing why we want these specific fields or add some comments to explain. The string field names should also be changed to constants incase it changes in the future.

None of these new tests seem to actually test authenticationCallback .As far as I understand, driver applications will be able to implement  SQLServerKeyVaultAuthenticationCallback.getAccessToken() API in 2 ways:

Using adal4j library, see the sample here.
Using msal4j library, as implemented below.
Regardless of which method the application chooses to use, the driver needs to be able to handle both. Please add appropriate tests for both scenarios. Make sure to use actual CEKs/CMK to encrypt/decrypt instead of using empty CEK.
Again, we are not removing the SQLServerKeyVaultAuthenticationCallback anymore, so keep this test as it is and add a test for TokenCredential separately.
Shouldn't the comment here and below for the constructors say "Creates a KeyVaultTokenCredential" instead of "Creates  a KeyVaultCredential"?

nodes.bodyText: Can just declare private static final List<String> akvTrustedEndpoints = getTrustedEndpoints(); since getTrustedEndpoints is static.

commit.message:
Merge pull request #7 from lilgreenbird/msal

Added tests and catch exception from getKeyClient

Merge pull request #8 from lilgreenbird/msal

added test for token credential and other cosmetic fixes
Fix AEv2 tests exclude for reqExternalSetup and cleanup (#1247)
Fix | Add null check for getObject() with LocalTime and LocalDate (#1250)

added all AKV tests to use reqExternalSetup tag so they will be skipped by default (#1254)

* skip AKV test properly

* removed enclave properties string to failed errors as enclave tests could be skipped
First pass at porting to new Key Vault
Everything now compiles, but I'm sure there are numerous bugs, and testing has not been run yet.
Beginning to re-enable some disabled unit tests
Add requirement for a tenant ID to be set to run tests
Upgrade gradle file to include equivalent dependencies as in pom.xml, and remove try / catch in some test code where it is not required.

Merge pull request #1 from peterbae/keyvault-upgrade

Add tenantID
Updating APIs to propagate tenantId. Still I am sure the tests will fail, but this is a step in the right direction.
Merge branch 'keyvault-upgrade' of github.com:JonathanGiles/mssql-jdbc into keyvault-upgrade
Updating method call to add missing tenantId
Wiring in vaultBaseUrl env var lookup for Key Vault
Fixes for Key and Crypto client

Fixes for Key and Crypto client
